<denchmark-h:h2>Undocumented behavior of goodFeaturesToTrack when maxCorners equals zero</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>Doc at "http://docs.opencv.org/3.0-beta/modules/imgproc/doc/feature_detection.html?highlight=goodfeaturestotrack" says: maxCorners â€“ Maximum number of corners to return. If there are more corners than are found, the strongest of them is returned.
In "/modules/imgproc/src/featureselect.cpp": if( maxCorners > 0 && (int)ncorners == maxCorners ) break;
The latter is equivalent to "maxCorners = +inf", when "maxCorners == 0".
Please either: - fix the code (by omitting "maxCorners > 0 &&") - fix the doc (by mentioning "maxCorners == 0" implies that no limit on the maximum is set) </denchmark-code>
